page.title: 11Local History
page.content: The area is agricultural,the greater part being the Manor of Thurnham,owned, since 1556,by the Dalton family which rented its lands to tenant farmers. After World War II many tenants purchased their farms,concentrating on Friesian cattle with a few sheep. Grass crops provide sileage.The area is clipped by a branch of the Lancaster canal leading into a basin now a marina:see account of adjoining area. The small population lives in separated farming settlements with two small hamlets each of half a dozen dwellings. Thurnham Hall,a seat of the Daltons,fell into disrepair during the 20th century and was renovated in the 1970's.The Daltons,Roman Catholic until the end of the 19th century,supported the building,near to the Hall,of first a chapel and then a church,consecrated in 1848.
